Static Public Member Functions

static WSESWrapperMain * instance ()

Detailed Description

This is the main class for the SESWrapper library.

All exported functions uses a global instance of WSESWrapperMain

Definition at line 9 of file wseswrappermain.h.

Member Function Documentation

int WSESWrapperMain::checkAnalyzerRegion ( SESWrapperNS::AnalyzerRegion *  analyzerRegion,
int *  steps,
double *  time_ms,
double *  minEnergyStep_eV 
)

Validates the current analyzer region.

In addition to validating the region, this function also returns the number of steps (for swept mode acquisitions) that will be taken, the minimum dwell time per step (ms), and the smallest step size (eV).

Parameters:
[out]analyzerRegionA pointer to a SESWrapperNS::AnalyzerRegion struct that will be filled with validated values.
[out]stepsThe number of steps that will be taken for a swept mode acquisition.
[out]time_msThe estimated acquisition time (in ms) for one iteration.
[out]minEnergyStep_eVThe minimum step size (in eV) for swept mode acquisition.
Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if loadInstrument() has not been called, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_ANALYZER_REGION if an error was detected in the analyzer region, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

Definition at line 654 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::centerEnergy_, SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::dwellTime_, SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::energyStep_, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_ANALYZER_REGION, WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT, WError::ERR_OK, SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::fixed_, WSESInstrument::GDS_CheckRegion, SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::highEnergy_, and SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::lowEnergy_.

int WSESWrapperMain::continueAcquisition ( )

Releases the acquisition thread after a blocked point or region. Blocking points or regions is done by setting blockPointReady or blockRegionReady to true in the initAcquisition() member function call.

See also:
waitForPointReady(), waitForRegionReady() initAcquisition(), startAcquisition(), stopAcquisition()

Definition at line 894 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_OK, WEvent::reset(), and WEvent::set().

int WSESWrapperMain::finalize ( )

Aborts any currently executing acquisition, and closes the SESInstrument.dll library.

If initialization of SESWrapper was made by a call to initialize(), this member function must be called before closing the library. If SESWrapper successfully made the initialization on startup, this member function does not need to be called, as that is then done automatically when the library closes.

Returns:
Always returns WError::ERR_OK.
See also:
initialize()

Definition at line 228 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_OK, WSESInstrument::GDS_Finalize, WLibrary::isLoaded(), WEvent::set(), and WSESInstrument::unload().

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqChannelIntensity ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_channel_intensity variable. This extracts the intensity from all slices of channel index. If index is negative or outside the energy range of the region, the function succeedes with data set to 0.

Parameters:
[in]indexThe point/channel to query. This can be negative or greater than the number of channels. An index of 0 corresponds to the first spectrum channel.
[out]dataA pointer to a double array that will be modified to the number of millisecondes elapsed since the last call of startAcquisition(). The array should be large enough to contain acq_slices slices.
[in,out]sizeModified to acq_slices.
Returns:
WError::ERR_OK on success, WError::ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED if no acquisition has been performed,

Definition at line 1591 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED, and WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqChannels ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_channels variable. If no acquisition has been performed, the number of channels is 0.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataA pointer to a 32-bit integer that will be modified with the number of energy channels in the acquired spectrum.
[in,out]sizeNot used.
Returns:
Always returns WError::ERR_OK.

References WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqChannelScale ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_channel_scale variable. Defines an array of doubles where each element corresponds to an energy channel. The scale is always in kinetic energy.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataAn array of doubles that will be filled with the channel scale. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array.
Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if no acquisition has been performed, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

Definition at line 1208 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_FAIL, and WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqChannelUnit ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_channel_unit variable. The channel unit is a string of up to 32 characters (including the null termination) defining the unit of the energy axis in the acquired spectrum.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataA char* buffer to be filled with the channel unit. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array.
Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if no acquisition has been performed, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqCurrentPoint ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_current_point variable. The point is only useful for swept mode acquisitions, and has a negative value until the acquisition has entered valid channels during the acquisition. It is important to use the waitForPointReady() function to make sure no data points are missed.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataA pointer to a 32-bit unsigned integer that shows the latest step index during a swept mode acquisition. This value is undefined until waitForPointReady() returns success, and remains negative until the acquisition has reached a valid channel.
[in,out]sizeNot used.
Returns:
Always returns WError::ERR_OK.

Definition at line 1538 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_OK.

Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if no acquisition has been performed, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqIOData ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_io_data variable. Extracts all External I/O data acquired.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataAn array of doubles that will be filled with the spectra acquired from the External I/O ports. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array (acq_io_ports * acq_io_size).
Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if External I/O is not available or if no acquisition has been initialized, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_io_port_name variable. Obtains the name of one port in the External I/O port list.

Parameters:
[in]indexThe index of the port that will be queried. Must be between 0 and acq_io_ports.
[out]dataA char* buffer to be filled with the name of the External I/O port specified by index. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array.
Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if External I/O is not available or if no acquisition has been initialized, WError::ERR_INDEX if index is out-of-bounds, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_io_size variable. This is used with the External I/O mechanizm, where the data is collected from a number of ports from e.g. a DAQ card. This variable show the size of one spectrum.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.

void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_io_spectrum variable. Extracts one spectrum from one of the External I/O ports. To extract all ports at once, use the acq_io_data variable instead.

Parameters:
[in]indexThe index of the port to be queried. Must be between 0 and acq_io_ports - 1.
[out]dataAn array of doubles that will be filled with the data acquired from External I/O port index. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array.
Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if External I/O is not available or if no acquisition has been initialized, WError::ERR_INDEX if index is out-of-bounds, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqIterations ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_iterations variable. The number of iterations is incremented by 1 when startAcquisition() is called. The counter is reset when initAcquisition() is called. If no acquisition has been performed, the number of iterations is 0.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataA pointer to a 32-bit integer that will be modified with the number of iterations that have elapsed since the last call of initAcquisition().
[in,out]sizeNot used.
Returns:
Always returns WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqRawImage ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_raw_image variable. Defines a byte array that will span the data in one frame taken from the detector. If the detector is not based on frames/images, this variable will not be available.

One frame usually has a size of xChannels * yChannels * byteSize, where xChannels and yChannels can be obtained from the detector_info property. The byteSize variable is the number of bytes used per element in the image, which is 1 for 8-bit images, or 2 for 16-bit images. To get the byteSize, call this function with data set to 0 (NULL) and then divide the size parameter obtained with xChannels * yChannels.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataAn array of bytes (unsigned char*) that will be filled with a snapshot of the detector image. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array (xChannels * yChannels * byteSize).
Returns:
WError::ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED if the wrapped library is not properly initialized, WError::ERR_FAIL if the raw image could not be obtained (possibly because the detector does not support 2D-frames), otherwise WError::ERR_OK on success.
See also:
WSESWrapperBase::getDetectorInfo()

Definition at line 1263 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_FAIL, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_DETECTOR_REGION, WError::ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED, WError::ERR_OK, and WSESInstrument::GDS_GetRawImage.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqSlice ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_slice variable. This function can be called to obtain one slice from the spectrum image.

Parameters:
[in]indexSpecifies which slice to extract from the spectrum. Must be between 0 and the number of slices - 1.
[out]dataAn array of doubles that will be filled with the elements of the slice. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array.
Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if no acquisition has been performed, WError::ERR_INDEX if index is out-of-bounds, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcqSpectrum ( int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

Getter for the acq_spectrum variable. The spectrum is a vector of doubles (8-byte floating point values) with the integrated intensities of all slices.

Parameters:
[in]indexNot used.
[out]dataAn array of doubles that will be filled with the integrated spectrum. Can be 0 (NULL).
[in,out]sizeIf data is non-null, this parameter is assumed to contain the maximum number of elements in the buffer. After completion, size is always modified to contain the length of the resulting array.
Returns:
WError::ERR_FAIL if no acquisition has been performed, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getAcquiredData ( const char *  variable,
int  index,
void *  data,
int &  size 
)

This is a generic function for obtaining the value of acquired data or related variables. The data parameter is declared void * in order to allow any type of data to be accessed.

Parameters:
[in]variableThe name of the variable to be queried.
[in]indexUsed to query a specific element from a variable that is stored as a vector.
[out]dataPointer to a variable that will be filled with the data specified by variable. This parameter can be 0 (NULL). In that case, size can be used to obtain the required size of data if the variable is a string or vector.
[in,out]sizeThis parameter is used to get the size of data when the variable is a string or vector.
Returns:
WError::ERR_PARAMETER_NOT_FOUND if variable was not a valid variable name, otherwise the return code depends on the type of variable.

Definition at line 812 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_PARAMETER_NOT_FOUND.

int WSESWrapperMain::getBindingEnergy ( double *  bindingEnergy)

Reads the current kinetic energy from the SESInstrument library and converts it to binding energy before returning.

Warning:
If the excitation energy has not been set before calling this function, the result is undefined.
Parameters:
[out]bindingEnergyPointer to a double to be modified with the current binding energy.
Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if loadInstrument() has not been called, WError::ERR_FAIL if the energy could not be read, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::getProperty ( const char *  property,
int  index,
void *  value,
int &  size 
)

This is a generic function for obtaining the value of a property. The value parameter is declared void * in order to allow any type of property to be accessed. The main requirement for all types of properties is that the value parameter is a pointer to the object containing the data of the property. All properties are defined with a getter and a setter in the WSESWrapperBase class.

Parameters:
[in]propertyA string specifying the property to be queried.
[in]indexFor those properties that are stored in arrays, this will indicate which array element is requested.
[out]valueA pointer to a variable that will be given the requested property.
[in,out]sizeThis parameter is used to get the size of value. In some cases (e.g. when the property is an array or string) this parameter specifies the number of elements. When value is 0 (NULL), size is modified to the required size of arrays/strings. When the property is a structure or number, size if not modified, and value cannot be 0.
Returns:
WError::ERR_PARAMETER_NOT_FOUND if the property was not a valid variable name, other wise the return code is dependent on the type of variable.
See also:
WSESWrapperBase, SESWrapper Library Variables

Definition at line 265 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED, WError::ERR_OK, WError::ERR_PARAMETER_NOT_FOUND, WError::ERR_WRONG_SIZE, and WSESInstrument::SC_GetProperty.

int WSESWrapperMain::initAcquisition ( const bool  blockPointReady,
const bool  blockRegionReady 
)

Initializes an acquisition.

This function initializes an acquisition. It sets the iteration index to 0, thus creating a new acquisition. The blockPointReady and blockRegionReady parameters specifies whether acquisition should pause for each step or regin, respectively.

Parameters:
[in]blockPointReadyIf true, this parameter tells the acquisition thread to wait for confirmation between each step taken in a swept mode acquisition.
[in]blockRegionReadyIf true, this parameter tells the acquisition thread to wait for confirmation once the acquisition is finished.
Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if loadInstrument() has not been called, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_ANALYZER_REGION if an error was detected in the analyzer region, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

Definition at line 684 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_FAIL, WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT, WError::ERR_OK, WSESInstrument::GDS_GetStatus, WSESInstrument::GDS_InitAcquisition, SesNS::NonOperational, WEvent::reset(), and SesNS::Running.

int WSESWrapperMain::initialize ( void *  reserved)

Opens the SESInstrument.dll library and imports the functions of that library.

When SESWrapper loads, it tries to load the SESInstrument library and run GDS_Initialize automatically. If successful, initialize() should not be called. However, if the SESInstrument library was not found during startup, the user needs to change the working directory to the SES software (using the lib_working_dir property) and then call initialize(). In that case, the user assumes the responsibility for calling the finalize() member function as well.

Parameters:
[in,out]reservedThis parameter is reserved for future use. It must be set to 0.
Returns:
Possible return codes: WError::ERR_OK on success, WError::ERR_LOAD_LIBRARY if the instrument library could not be loaded, WError::ERR_INITIALIZE_FAIL if the initialization failed.
See also:
finalize()

Definition at line 152 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

void WSESWrapperMain::release ( )

Releases a reference of the WSESWrapper object. This function must be called the same number of times the instance() function has been called. Note that this function is not a static function (like the instance() function is).

int WSESWrapperMain::startAcquisition ( )

Starts an acquisition.

If WAnalyzerRegion::fixed_ is set to true (or 1), this will start one fixed mode acquisition. If set to false (or 0), a swept mode acquisition is started. initAcquisition() must be called the first time an acquisition will be made. After that, startAcquisition() can be called any number of times to accumulate data to the same spectrum. All data is stored in the temporary file specified by the temp_file_name property, which can later be used translate the results to e.g. an Igor format. Before calling this member function, the analyzer_region and detector_region properties should be properly prepared with correct region settings. It is possible to validate the analyzer settings by calling checkanalyzerRegion() before calling this.

The function returns immediately to allow the caller to continue working. Use waitForPointReady() and/or waitForRegionReady() if blocking is required.

Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if loadInstrument() has not been called, WError::ERR_FAIL if the acquisition could not be started (e.g. another acquisition is already running), otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

Definition at line 742 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_ACQUIRING, WError::ERR_FAIL, WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT, WError::ERR_OK, WSESInstrument::GDS_GetCurrSignals, WSESInstrument::GDS_GetStatus, WSESInstrument::GDS_Start, WSESInstrument::GDS_UseDetector, WSESInstrument::GDS_UseSignals, SesNS::NonOperational, WEvent::reset(), and SesNS::Running.

int WSESWrapperMain::stopAcquisition ( )

Aborts the current acquisition. Can be called at any time to stop an active acquisition and set the library to an idle state.

Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if loadInstrument() has not been called, WError::ERR_FAIL if the acquisition could not be stopped, otherwise WError::ERR_OK.

int WSESWrapperMain::validate ( const char *  elementSet,
const char *  lensMode,
double  passEnergy,
double  kineticEnergy 
)

Validates the element set, lens mode, pass energy and kinetic energy (the kinetic energy is currently not checked and will thus always result in success). This member function will return WError::ERR_OK if the supplied combination of elementSet, lensMode, passEnergy and kineticEnergy is valid.

Parameters:
[in]elementSetThe element set to be validated.
[in]lensModeThe lens mode to be validated.
[in]passEnergyThe pass energy to be validated.
[in]kineticEnergyThe kinetic energy to be validated. Currently not checked.
Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if no instrument is loaded, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_ELEMENT_SET if the given element set is invalid, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_LENS_MODE is the given lens mode is invalid, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_PASS_ENERGY if the given pass energy is not available for the given lens mode. If the validation is successful, returns WError::ERR_OK.

Definition at line 340 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_INCORRECT_ELEMENT_SET, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_LENS_MODE, WError::ERR_INCORRECT_PASS_ENERGY, WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT, WError::ERR_OK, and WSESWrapperBase::loadPassEnergies().

int WSESWrapperMain::waitForPointReady ( int  timeout_ms)

Blocks execution of the callers thread until the current point has been completed during a swept mode acquisition. If timeout_ms is set to -1, there is no time-out. Do not use -1 when running fixed mode acquisitions, as there is no step taken in those cases, so there is no event that can unlock this. The WError::ERR_TIMEOUT is a warning code (error code > 0) which can be used to separate behavior from more serious errors.

Parameters:
[in]timeout_msThe number of milliseconds to wait until time-out.
Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if loadInstrument() has not been called. Returns immediately with a WError::ERR_OK if there is no acquisition running. WError::ERR_OK is returned when the measured point has been completed. WError::ERR_TIMEOUT is returned if the function times out before comletion of the point.
See also:
continueAcquisition(), waitForPointReady(), initAcquisition(), startAcquisition(), stopAcquisition()

Definition at line 838 of file wseswrappermain.cpp.

References WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT, WError::ERR_OK, WError::ERR_TIMEOUT, WSESInstrument::GDS_GetStatus, WEvent::handle(), SesNS::NonOperational, and SesNS::Running.

int WSESWrapperMain::waitForRegionReady ( int  timeout_ms)

Blocks execution of the callers thread until the current region has been completed. If timeout_ms is set to -1, there is no time-out. This can be used for both fixed and swept mode acquisitions. The WError::ERR_TIMEOUT is a warning code (error code > 0) which can be used to separate behavior from more serious errors.

Parameters:
[in]timeout_msThe number of milliseconds to wait until time-out.
Returns:
WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT if loadInstrument() has not been called. Returns immediately with a WError::ERR_OK if there is no acquisition running. WError::ERR_OK is returned when the measured region has been completed. WError::ERR_TIMEOUT is returned if the function times out before comletion of the point.
See also:
continueAcquisition(), waitForPointReady(), initAcquisition(), startAcquisition(), stopAcquisition()

References WError::ERR_NO_INSTRUMENT, WError::ERR_OK, WError::ERR_TIMEOUT, WSESInstrument::GDS_GetStatus, WEvent::handle(), SesNS::NonOperational, and SesNS::Running.
